background_description: The background consists of a seabed covered with fine sandy gravel, small irregular rocks, and patches of darker brown and green detritus or small algae. The colors are predominantly light beige, off-white, muted browns, and some reddish-purple hues from the rocks, with darker organic material scattered throughout.
camouflage_type: Color blending / Pattern matching / Shape disruption
explanation: The Pipefish exhibits excellent camouflage by closely matching the color and texture of the gravelly seabed with detritus. Its elongated body has a pale beige/off-white base color, which blends seamlessly with the sand and lighter rocks. Over this, it displays intricate dark brown and black reticulated patterns, dots, and lines that mimic the shadows, darker rocks, and patches of detritus/algae on the seabed. This combination effectively breaks up its outline (shape disruption) and allows it to blend into the mottled background, making it very difficult to distinguish from its immediate environment. The subtle yellowish hues on its head and body also match some of the warmer tones in the gravel.
